    • Constructor Detail

      • CloudOfThingsRestClient

        public CloudOfThingsRestClient(okhttp3.OkHttpClient okHttpClient,
                               String host,
                               String user,
                               String password)
        Parameters:
        okHttpClient - HTTP client that is used to interact with the API.
        host - URL to connect to. Must contain scheme and host, e.g. https://username.int2-ram.m2m.telekom.com
        user - Username for authentication.
        password - Password for authentication.

    • Method Detail

      • doRequestWithIdResponse

        public String doRequestWithIdResponse(String json,
                                      String api,
                                      String contentType,
                                      String accept)
        Executes an HTTP POST request and parses the response Header. Response header 'Location' will be split to get the ID of the object (mostly created).
        Parameters:
        json - Request body, needs to be a json object correlating to the contentType.
        api - the REST API string.
        contentType - the Content-Type of the JSON Object.
        accept - the accept header of the response JSON Object.
        Returns:
        the id of the Object.

      • doPostRequest

        public String doPostRequest(String json,
                            String api,
                            String contentType,
                            String accept)
        Executes an HTTP POST request and returns the response body as String.
        Parameters:
        json - Request body, needs to be a json object correlating to the contentType.
        api - the REST API string.
        contentType - the Content-Type of the JSON Object.
        accept - the Accept header for the request
        Returns:
        the received JSON response body.

      • doFormUpload

        public String doFormUpload(String file,
                           String name,
                           String api,
                           String contentType)
        Executes a multipart form upload of a string and returns the response body as String.
        Parameters:
        file - Request body, i.e. the first and only form part.
        name - The name of the form field.
        api - the URL path (without leading /)
        contentType - a String with the Content-Type to set in header of the request.
        Returns:
        the response body

      • doFormUpload

        public String doFormUpload(byte[][] files,
                           String[] names,
                           String api)
        Executes an HTTP POST request and returns the response body as String.
        Parameters:
        files - array of byte[], one for each form field.
        names - the names of the form field, same order as files.
        api - the URL path (without leading /)
        Returns:
        the ID from the Location header (for newly created objects), or null if there's no Location header.

      • doRealTimePollingRequest

        public String doRealTimePollingRequest(String json,
                                       String api,
                                       String contentType,
                                       Integer timeout)
        Do a real time polling request, i.e. the connect call. We use a different client for this call, because it's supposed to have very long timeouts, unsuitable for regular requests. Regular real time polling and smart rest real time polling share the same client (and therefore timeout) because it is to be expected that a client will probably use either one of them, but not both.
        Parameters:
        json - Request body, needs to be a json object correlating to the contentType.
        api - the REST API string.
        contentType - the Content-Type of the JSON Object.
        timeout - the new timeout for real time requests. null = don't change the current timeout
        Returns:
        the received JSON response body.

      • doSmartRealTimeRequest

        public SmartResponse doSmartRealTimeRequest(SmartRequest smartRequest)
        Do a SmartREST real time request.
        Parameters:
        smartRequest - the request with meta information and lines to send to platform.
        Returns:
        the SmartResponse

      • doSmartRealTimePollingRequest

        public SmartResponse doSmartRealTimePollingRequest(SmartRequest smartRequest,
                                                   Integer timeout)
        Do a SmartREST real time polling request, i.e. the connect call. We use a different client for this call, because it's supposed to have very long timeouts, unsuitable for regular requests. Regular real time polling and smart rest real time polling share the same client (and therefore timeout) because it is to be expected that a client will probably use either one of them, but not both.
        Parameters:
        smartRequest - the request with meta information and lines to send to platform.
        timeout - the new timeout for real time requests. null = don't change the current timeout
        Returns:
        the SmartResponse

      • doSmartRequest

        public SmartResponse doSmartRequest(SmartRequest smartRequest)
        Do a SmartREST-request.
        Parameters:
        smartRequest - the request with meta information and lines to send to platform.
        Returns:
        the SmartResponse

      • getResponse

        public String getResponse(String id,
                          String api,
                          String accept)
        Executes an HTTP GET request and returns the response body as String.
        Parameters:
        id - id of managed object
        api - api name e.g. measurement
        accept - accept header for request
        Returns:
        the response from cloud of things

        public byte[] getResponseInBytes(String id,
                                 String api,
                                 String accept)
        Executes an HTTP GET request and returns the response body as byte array.
        Parameters:
        id - id of managed object
        api - api name e.g. measurement
        accept - accept header for request
        Returns:
        the response from cloud of things

        public String doPutRequest(String data,
                           String path,
                           String contentType)
        Execute a PUT request.
        Parameters:
        data - the body to send
        path - the URL path (without leading '/')
        contentType - the Content-Type header
        Returns:
        the response body, if there was one (empty string otherwise)

      • doPutRequest

        public String doPutRequest(String data,
                           String path,
                           String contentType,
                           String accept)
        Execute a PUT request.
        Parameters:
        data - the body to send
        path - the URL path (without leading '/')
        contentType - the Content-Type header
        accept - the Accept header (may be null)
        Returns:
        the response body, if there was one (empty string otherwise)

      • doPutRequestWithIdResponseInBytes

        public String doPutRequestWithIdResponseInBytes(byte[] data,
                                                String path,
                                                String contentType)
        Execute a PUT request that will result in a new or changed ID.
        Parameters:
        data - the body to send in bytes
        path - the URL path (without leading '/')
        contentType - the Content-Type header
        Returns:
        the ID from the Location header (for newly created objects), or null if there's no Location header.

      • doPutRequestWithIdResponse

                                         String path,
                                         String contentType)
        Execute a PUT request that will result in a new or changed ID.
        Parameters:
        data - the body to send
        path - the URL path (without leading '/')
        contentType - the Content-Type header
        Returns:
        the ID from the Location header (for newly created objects), or null if there's no Location header.
